comments.body: updateRenderObject isn't updated here. Please make sure to add a test that catches that error.
Would it be sufficient to just set the drag start behavior in `updateRenderObject`? I'm not entirely sure what you mean by this also.
What happens if this is set to null? Should there be an assert to ensure that nobody does that?
Yah, tho shouldn't that happen in the monodrag.dart file?

Both places should probably assert. The earlier we have the assert the easier it is for developers to see what went wrong. A developer would use the switch directly, and if he/she sees an assert in an internal widget it may be unclear how to fix that.
In other words: Iâ€™d add the assert to all constructors that take a dragStartBehavior argument.
This should also document what the default is.
Is this right? If you just long press a switch in native and don't move, the bubble grows/reacts already.
yah, I think Cupertino switches respond to taps and drags, this behavior change only affects the drag.

Sorry this is becoming more complicated than initially thought. There's a bunch of nuances here it seems. On iOS, as far as I can tell, it's not possible to move enough to break the drag slop, but not enough to put the knob onto the other side and still get a knock. It may be possible here. Worth testing.

I mean, the current implementation of the switch is wrong in respect to iOS 12. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/27962 . Given that, I don't think there's really a completely 'correct' way to implement the vibration for the version of the switch that exists in flutter. No worries about the complication!

Cool, 2 small nit picks for this PR and in general.

1- Keep all documentations and comments in terse but full sentence forms (so with all the articles, punctuations etc).

```dart
/// The [value] parameter must not be null.
/// The [dragStartBehavior] parameter defaults to DragStartBehavior.start and must not be null 
```

2- Each class field's documentation, when extracted, will end up in its own web page (such as https://docs.flutter.io/flutter/cupertino/CupertinoSwitch/value.html) and needs to be able to stand alone. Document this in line 70 as well.
